meanings.definition: To descend from a vehicle or horse.
meanings.sent1: The passengers were alighting from the bus one by one.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was alighting from his horse after a long ride.
meanings.sent3: The clown alighting from the tiny car brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Like a graceful dancer, she was alighting from the carriage.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bird alighting from the tree was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To come down and settle, as a bird.
meanings.sent1: The colorful parrot was alighting on the branch to rest.
meanings.sent2: The robin was alighting gently on the ground to find worms.
meanings.sent3: The pigeon alighting on the statue looked quite content with its choice of perch.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly alighting on the flower was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The hummingbird alighting on the feeder was a fleeting moment of beauty.
